summary: A DLC-sized mod sending players to the Fifth Era, where they are present in Southern Tamriel and the Summerset Isles with 40+ hours of fully voiced lore friendly (but not canon) quests, dungeons, and more.
descriptionHtml:
[center][b]DISCLAIMER: [/b]DominionSoft Indie does not support unofficial translations or unofficial uploads of the mod. If you are playing an unauthorized translation or unlisted download of the English version, we cannot and do not guarantee that your version of [i]ES: Dominion[/i] has not been altered or that it is up to date.[/center]

[center][font=Georgia][size=6]What is [i]Dominion[/i]?[/size][/font][/center]
[font=Tahoma][i]The[/i] [i]Elder Scrolls: Dominion[/i] is a [i]Skyrim[/i] expansion mod of DLC proportion which adds four entirely new worldspaces to the game along with a multitude of new and re-textured items. Using a modified version of the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/9557/?]Live Another Life Mod by Arthmoor[/url], whenever a new game begins, the player will create their own unique character and either choose the following options: "Play Skyrim" or "Play Dominion". Choosing the [i]Dominion[/i] storyline transports the player to the Summerset Isles where they'll begin their new journey, starting anew in the Fifth Era as the Great Conqueror (protagonist). There are four new lands, many places, people, quests, dungeons, books, recipes, weapons and armors, and more for the Great Conqueror to experience. [i]Dominion[/i] roughly adds 40+ hours of content and favours all types of characters.[/font]

[font=Georgia][size=5]Features
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Tahoma][size=2]Four new worldspaces where players can visit the Summerset Isles, Valenwood, Elsweyr, and part of Cyrodiil.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Tahoma][size=2]40+ hours of gameplay.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Tahoma][size=2]Over 40 new quests, including a 7 quest long main story, and over 33 side quests (along with some unmarked content).[/size][/font]
[*][font=Tahoma][size=2]New items including books, recipes, weapons and armors (from completely new to re-textured).[/size][/font]
[*][font=Tahoma][size=2]New spells.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Tahoma][size=2]New bards with songs taken from the [i]Elder Scrolls Online[/i].[/size][/font]
[*][font=Tahoma][size=2]A soundtrack containing 14+ tracks taken from the [i]Elder Scrolls Online[/i].[/size][/font]
[*][font=Tahoma][size=2]A fully voiced experience, featuring many professional and semi-professional voice actors and actresses.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Tahoma][size=2]Completely new and unique NPCs and merchants.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Tahoma][size=2]10 Potential player homes throughout the Aldmeri Dominion.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Tahoma][size=2]Over 40+ immersive cities, towns, and villages.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Tahoma][size=2]Boss battles and mini-boss battles.[/size][/font]
[/list]
[font=Georgia][size=6][center]What are the Requirements?[/center][/size][/font][font=Tahoma]In order to play [i]The Elder Scrolls: Dominion[/i], you must have the latest version of [i]The[/i] [i]Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim[/i] (1.9.32.0.8 as of 12 July 2013). You also need to have [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/72850/]every DLC in the game[/url] and additional utility mods such as [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]SKSE [/url]and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/?]SkyUI[/url]. In addition to utility mods, its recommended that you play [i]Dominion[/i] on a Windows 7, 8.1, or 10 gaming desktop or laptop with an NVIDIA graphics card or similar. Intel graphic cards and low-end non-gaming pcs and laptops could constantly crash [i]Dominion[/i] and ruin gaming performance. The [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2488/?tab=1&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmoddescription%2F%3Fid%3D2488%26preview%3D&pUp=1]Better Males Mod by Chris57 and FavouredSoul[/url] (GeneoxFaces and NoMoreBlockyFaces), [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55555/?]RS Children Overhaul by Ranaline[/url], [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17802/?]Climates of Tamriel by JJC71[/url], [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63839/?]I Cant Believe Its NOT ENB 3 by ElSopa[/url], [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/40440/?]Font Replacement by GeeGee[/url], [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/72431/?]Aldmeri Dominion Banner by Shinkoku[/url], and our modified version of Alternative Start: Live Another Life are also required in order to play [i]Dominion[/i].[/font]

[center][font=Georgia][size=6]How to start [i]Dominion[/i]?
[/size][/font][/center]
[font=Tahoma]The only way to play [i]Dominion[/i] once you meet the requirements is to start a fresh game with only the listed mods above in requirements activated. Other mods have a possibility of conflicting with [i]Dominion[/i] and can thus ruin your experience.

After creating and naming your character, go to the Statue of Mara and activate it. Choose the "Start Dominion" option and go to the bed. When in the bed, you will then be transported to the Summerset Isles where the Dominion Main Storyline begins.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Do NOT use console to set stages, open doors, or disabled objects!!! This mod has been rigorously tested and nothing should be broken, so by doing this you void any hope for support, and will most likely break stuff, if not the whole standalone expansion pack itself.[/font]

[size=6][font=Georgia][center]How to Uninstall [i]Dominion?[/i][/center][/font][/size][font=Tahoma]The uninstalling of [i]Dominion[/i] mid-game is NOT supported at all. [i]Dominion[/i] is simply too big of a mod. Treat [i]Dominion[/i] like a DLC or standalone title, and DO NOT remove it during a playthrough. Only remove [i]Dominion[/i] if you have beat the DLC-mod and are tired of it, or if you just wish to start a new game without [i]Dominion[/i] or its modified Life Another Life Mod. If you do want to play [i]The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim[/i] without uninstalling Dominion, simply start a new game and go to the statue and select "Start Skyrim" instead of "Start Dominion".[/font]
author: DominionSoft Indie
